segments.text: In this drawing, the kitchen looks so ordinary at first glance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I see the water cascading from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a disgusting mess, flooding the floor and cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is clueless, focused only on her dish towel and plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress and apron will be ruined by that filthy water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are raiding the cookie jar like little thieves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's perched precariously on that stool, hand deep in the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl waits eagerly, but this whole sneaky act feels off.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden is neat, making the inside sloppiness even worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hate seeing potential damage to the wood and floors from the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Stacked dishes by the sink are at risk of getting wet too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's sad how unaware everyone is of the growing problems.
segments.speaker: PAR
